section:
SECTION 8: DATABASE MANAGEMENT
GENERAL OBJECTIVE
On completion of this Section
objective: The effectiveness with which the student uses formatting facilities to create and enhance the document.
content: • Formatting for presentation - justification - single and double line spacing - paragraph styling (indent, hanging, block) • Formatting for emphasis - bold - italics - borders and shading to highlight and give emphasis - font and point size • Other features - use of spell checker/search and replace/grammar check - search and replace
specific_objectives: The effectiveness with which the student uses formatting facilities to create
enhance the document.
content_items: block) • Formatting for emphasis - bold - italics - borders
point size • Other features - use of spell checker/search

section:
SECTION 8: DATABASE MANAGEMENT
GENERAL OBJECTIVE
On completion of this Section
objective: The effectiveness with which students use formatting facilities to present information.
content: • Page Layout - set margins - change page orientations - change paper size - text orientation • Headers/footers/endnotes • Tables
specific_objectives: The effectiveness with which students use formatting facilities to present information.
content_items: Page Layout - set margins - change page orientations - change paper size - text orientation • Headers/footers/endnotes • Tables

section:
SECTION 8: DATABASE MANAGEMENT
GENERAL OBJECTIVE
On completion of this Section
objective: The effectiveness with which students use facilities to create flyers or brochures.
content: • Multiple page/book fold/columns • Use of graphics • Clarity of itemization - insert/delete (word, sentence, paragraph document) - block operations - move/copy/cut and paste
specific_objectives: The effectiveness with which students use facilities to create flyers
brochures.
content_items: Multiple page/book fold/columns • Use of graphics • Clarity of itemization - insert/delete (word

section:
SECTION 8: DATABASE MANAGEMENT
GENERAL OBJECTIVE
On completion of this Section
objective: The effectiveness with which students use facilities to perform mail merge.
content: • Defining appropriate fields in the document • Creating primary document • Creating secondary document appropriately • Performing the mail merge
specific_objectives: The effectiveness with which students use facilities to perform mail merge.
content_items: Defining appropriate fields in the document • Creating primary document • Creating secondary document appropriately • Performing the mail merge

section:
SECTION 8: DATABASE MANAGEMENT
GENERAL OBJECTIVE
On completion of this Section
objective: The effectiveness with which students use pre-defined systems functions to form arithmetic, logical and relation expressions.
content: • Demonstrating awareness of the existence of appropriate formulae • Use of appropriate formulae to solve numeric problems • Replicating formulae • Use of range names, relative and absolute addressing formats
specific_objectives: The effectiveness with which students use pre-defined systems functions to form arithmetic
logical
relation expressions.
content_items: Demonstrating awareness of the existence of appropriate formulae • Use of appropriate formulae to solve numeric problems • Replicating formulae • Use of range names

section:
SECTION 8: DATABASE MANAGEMENT
GENERAL OBJECTIVE
On completion of this Section
objective: The effectiveness with which students manipulate the spreadsheet.
content: • Copying data • Moving data • Use of formatting features to allow clarity of display • Inserting page breaks appropriately • Deleting and inserting rows such that formulae remain unaffected
specific_objectives: The effectiveness with which students manipulate the spreadsheet.
content_items: Copying data • Moving data • Use of formatting features to allow clarity of display • Inserting page breaks appropriately • Deleting
inserting rows such that formulae remain unaffected

content: • Setting up primary and secondary key fields
specific_objectives: The effectiveness with which students use the search

section:
SECTION 8: DATABASE MANAGEMENT
GENERAL OBJECTIVE
On completion of this Section
objective: The effectiveness with which students perform graphic operations to present information.
content: • Creating appropriate charts to represent data - bar, pie, line, from spreadsheet data • Labelling charts appropriately • Comparing different series of data on a single bar chart or line graph
specific_objectives: The effectiveness with which students perform graphic operations to present information.
content_items: Creating appropriate charts to represent data - bar
from spreadsheet data • Labelling charts appropriately • Comparing different series of data on a single bar chart

section:
SECTION 8: DATABASE MANAGEMENT
GENERAL OBJECTIVE
On completion of this Section
objective: The effectiveness with which students use facilities in creating and modifying database.
content: • Defining fields and selecting appropriate data types to create tables • Identifying appropriate primary keys • Adding/deleting/sorting/ modifying records or tuples • Deleting fields and changing field definitions
specific_objectives: The effectiveness with which students use facilities in creating
modifying database.
content_items: selecting appropriate data types to create tables • Identifying appropriate primary keys • Adding/deleting/sorting/ modifying records

section:
SECTION 8: DATABASE MANAGEMENT
GENERAL OBJECTIVE
On completion of this Section
objective: The effectiveness with which students use the query facility.
content: • Searching database - use three tables, two tables one table in queries to generate new tables - use multiple conditions • Producing calculated fields
specific_objectives: The effectiveness with which students use the query facility.
content_items: two tables one table in queries to generate new tables - use multiple conditions • Producing calculated fields

section:
SECTION 8: DATABASE MANAGEMENT
GENERAL OBJECTIVE
On completion of this Section
objective: The effectiveness with which student use report generating facilities.
content: • Generating report on specified fields • Grouping on fields • Sorting on fields • Using summary features, for example, count and sum
specific_objectives: The effectiveness with which student use report generating facilities.
content_items: Generating report on specified fields • Grouping on fields • Sorting on fields • Using summary features

section:
SECTION 8: DATABASE MANAGEMENT
GENERAL OBJECTIVE
On completion of this Section
objective: Problem statement that defines the problem.
content: • Problem is clearly defined
specific_objectives: Problem statement that defines the problem.

section:
SECTION 8: DATABASE MANAGEMENT
GENERAL OBJECTIVE
On completion of this Section
objective: Representing the solution in flowchart or pseudocode.
content: • Start of solution • Definition of variables - identify variables - initialize variables • Processing - request for data - storing data - appropriate and logical use of control structures: selection statements; looping constructs - output results • End of solution
specific_objectives: Representing the solution in flowchart
pseudocode.
content_items: Start of solution • Definition of variables - identify variables - initialize variables • Processing - request for data - storing data - appropriate
logical use of control structures: selection statements
looping constructs - output results • End of solution

section:
SECTION 8: DATABASE MANAGEMENT
GENERAL OBJECTIVE
On completion of this Section
objective: Constructing the trace table.
content: • ALL variables correctly identified and used • Appropriate test data • Data set complete - data set test ALL areas for robustness - [data set test SOME areas] • Change in values correctly demonstrated
specific_objectives: Constructing the trace table.
content_items: used • Appropriate test data • Data set complete - data set test ALL areas for robustness - [data set test SOME areas] • Change in values correctly demonstrated

section:
SECTION 8: DATABASE MANAGEMENT
GENERAL OBJECTIVE
On completion of this Section
objective: The effectiveness with which the program achieved the objective.
content: • Program compiled (1) • Output (2) - output is correct for ALL values in teacher’s data set [Output is correct for SOME values in the teacher’s data set]
specific_objectives: The effectiveness with which the program achieved the objective.
content_items: Program compiled (1) • Output (2) - output is correct for ALL values in teacher’s data set [Output is correct for SOME values in the teacher’s data set]

section:
SECTION 8: DATABASE MANAGEMENT
GENERAL OBJECTIVE
On completion of this Section
objective: The effectiveness with which the language features are used to achieve a working solution.
content: • Appropriate use of features of the language (2) - appropriate choice of data types for ALL variables [appropriate choice of data types for SOME variables] • Appropriate use of control structures (7) - appropriate initialization of variables - appropriate use of sequence - appropriate use of if then else construct [inefficient use of if then construct]
specific_objectives: The effectiveness with which the language features are used to achieve a working solution.
content_items: Appropriate use of features of the language (2) - appropriate choice of data types for ALL variables [appropriate choice of data types for SOME variables] • Appropriate use of control structures (7) - appropriate initialization of variables - appropriate use of sequence - appropriate use of if then else construct [inefficient use of if then construct]

section: section provides a clear statement of the problem
objective: The effectiveness with which the language features are used to achieve a working solution. (cont’d)
content: - appropriate use of looping construct to manipulate arrays and perform other tasks [inefficient or inappropriate use of loop construct]
specific_objectives: The effectiveness with which the language features are used to achieve a working solution. (cont’d)
content_items: appropriate use of looping construct to manipulate arrays

section: section provides a clear statement of the problem
objective: The effectiveness with which the language features are used to achieve clarity.
content: • Clarity of program (3) - program documentation through variable names; author of program; date created; simple statement of task program solves - readability (correctly indented; logical flow of control; easy to follow;) - user-friendly.
specific_objectives: The effectiveness with which the language features are used to achieve clarity.
content_items: Clarity of program (3) - program documentation through variable names
simple statement of task program solves - readability (correctly indented
